lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughing) Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical-- fuck you, Liam! Fuck you! Tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons and Dragons.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First and foremost, our wonderful sponsor tonight, returning to sponsor the show, Lootcrate!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He did make a video, however, to help get us in the spirit of Lootcrate's awesomeness.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to go ahead and show that for us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (worried noise) Anyway. I just did a lot of downhill skiing today, and it was pretty cool, but not as cool as the stuff you can get inside Lootcrate. Sign up now and you'll save so much money, you can come on an exciting vacation to Park City, Utah, buy skis, and gloves, and go skiing. With me! Sam Riegel, a.k.a Scanlan Shorthalt from TV's-- well. The internet's Critical Role! Anyway, I'm about to go do my last run. Hope I don't break my leg. (worried noise) If I do, I won't see you on Thursday, but if I don't, let's roll high. Bye-bye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you very much, Sam. We look forward to having you back next week in one form or another.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But to finish up the details of our wonderful Lootcrate sponsorship, we have Ashley Johnson joining us thankfully from New York.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Tonight's episode of Critical Role is brought to you by Lootcrate. The theme for this month is 'build' and the brands that are in it include Power Rangers, Batman, Leego, Lego, and Tetris. All things you can build. The promo link is lootcrate.com/criticalrole. And the promo code is 'criticalrole', one word, for 10% off your first month. What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was so good. That was--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have to get a plane back to New York now, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so, next up we have merch announcements. Laura, do you want to go ahead?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh gosh, yeah! Okay, you guys. I know we've been teasing it for a while, but guess what we have back in stock?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are those the Critical Role dice sets?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't get too excited right now, 'cause they're not in the store at this very moment, okay? We're putting them up for sale tomorrow at noon our time, Pacific Standard Time, so that, you know, all you lovely folks that don't get to watch at 7PM on Thursdays can maybe snag 'em tomorrow afternoon, too. So, 12PM. Go to the store tomorrow. That's Friday, and you will get one of these cool things.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They've all been anointed with our individual musks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's right. We've licked very bag.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I put a bunch in my bra, walked around for a day.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Swished it right to left. Right to left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So come check us out. I think that's it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyone else have anything they wanna talk about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, then. Then, let's bring it down just a little bit--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And welcome back. So, to get you caught up on the current events of Critical Role. The party, Vox Machina, has been combating the horrible, terrible influence of the Chroma Conclave, a group of chromatic dragons that have been terrorizing the countryside of Tal'Dorei, occupying the city of Emon, Westruun, and places beyond. They've managed to kill off all the members of the Conclave, leading up to Raishan, the orchestrator behind the scenes of most of the chaos that they've seen in recent months. Raishan managed to nearly destroy Vox Machina before absconding with the corpse of Thordak, apparently into the next portion of her plot. The party, upon running into an old friend, Kerrek from Westruun, who had helped in the attack on Emon, joined forces to give chase, in hopes through your decision to head her off at the pass and prevent Raishan from seeing to fruition whatever plan she had after this leg. Through a series of very well-placed scrys, you discovered that she had absconded to the island of Viscond, an old lair of Thordak's and before that, an older lair of Opash, an ancient necromancer who was banished and made that his lair. As you made your way to the island, hopefully prepared for this, you've fought through various traps and difficult challenges throughout the necromancer's sanctum, eventually coming into battle with Raishan herself. A long hard-fought battle left Percy and Scanlan both lifeless to the ground. Percy was risen quickly. Scanlan, unfortunately, was not. And the final blow delivered a combination of both Keyleth tearing the intellect from Raishan through a well-placed Feeblemind spell and Kerrek with a well-placed warhammer blow to the head of the green dragon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're just hitting him in the face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The dragon destroyed. However, their friend, Scanlan, still lifeless and still, growing colder as the minutes passed. Picked up his body and you fled the cavern to the outside of the island after discovering the teleportation or, at least, the magic of transport had some sort of an alteration or a funkiness to it, if you will. You watched as two of your allies, Kima and Allura, were, instead of teleporting away through a circle, sent deep out into the ocean. You managed to find them (laughs) through a very lucky perception roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And at least was able-- you were able to connect your Transport via Plants through one of the outside trees by the beach to get you all to Whitestone. There you took Scanlan's body to the recently constructed temple to the Raven Queen and in preparing for this ritual the Gatestone was taken by Vex, who with the help of the Realmseer Eskil Ryndarien, transported to Kymal, made your way through the riff-raff to one of the darkened taverns there, to find Kaylie, Scanlan's daughter, long-estranged and rambunctious daughter but daughter nonetheless. Handed her the Gatestone and she vanished in a puff of arcane smoke, leaving you and-- Eskil more confused than you, within the tavern. And that... is where we jump back in for the evening.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as you guys are waiting carefully, figuring out what to do in these moments. Pike, as you're cleaning the area, cleaning the body and doing the best you can to begin preparing for a ritual that you are hoping will be in the favor of you and your friends. Percy, as you hold the other end of the Gatestone, you feel it begin to glow and warm in your hand and you instinctively take a step back as within a bright flash (fizzle sound) you watch as Kaylie, the gnomish, short-haired, rambunctious bard stands there now, near the entranceway to the Raven Queen's temple holding the other Gatestone. She's clutching it, her face still stoic and confused by the sudden transference. She takes it and drops it to the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Pardon me big man" And you watch as she darts up to where Pike is currently preparing the body for the ritual.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You made me a promise!" And she leans forward, kneels down and slaps him across the face (cracking sound) "You made me a promise." And she gets up and (sniffle) wipes her nose a bit and hops off and just storms

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, she just keeps charging, not stopping not slowing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You eventually get outside. You guys watch as Kaylie pushes past, and then Pike shortly thereafter. She spins around, looking at you. You can see her fists are clenched at her sides, face still dry but you can see the water just slightly, barely keeping back in her eyes. She goes, "What?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Listen, I know how angry you are--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: --but we need you here today. So he can at least have more of a chance to be the father that you've always wanted him to be.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You have no idea how much he loves you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) "Oh, he's- he's loved a lot of girls in his days. That I'm certain."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That may be true, but not as much as you

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, have we time for a drink?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm going to get a drink." And she just walks back into Whitestone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're still in there, right now by yourself, as Pike just pushed past you, and you have Scanlan alone, on the altar.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I go over to him? Does he look the same?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks the same, just...paler. He's been cleaned, so, the rest of you are a mess still, but he's clean, his hair is pulled back and brushed a bit by Pike as part of the preparation for the ritual, his clothes still tattered and worn from previous battles but--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I reach out and put my hand on his chest? Do I feel anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing. It's cold to the touch. He's been gone for a while now and there's very little difference between the touch of the stone he's on and the chest other than the fleshy texture.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Pike, you go in and finish the preparations for the ritual. And the ritual itself is an hour long once the spell is engaged. You're just cleansing the temple, some of the leaves that have blown in. What's everybody else doing in the meantime?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm organising, getting any materials that we need

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'm half way between disbelief and wanting to see how somebody else runs their priestly-- this is sort of like a professional interest, what is this guy doing to appease the Raven Queen this way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sniffs) "All right, let's get it over with." And you can smell the alcohol. She stumbles up to the temple and puts her hands on the altar "So, do your thing."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She turns around and looks up at you as she is, practically, just past your thigh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You look so much like him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well be careful, I'm at the right height to be juggling your-- (laughs half-heartedly)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She lingers on your eye contact for a second, gives a nod.  She gives you a tap and turns back around, and puts her hands on the altar.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I guess we'll go ahead and get started. (sighs shakily)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pull out the diamond component of this resurrection ritual. If you want to mark it off within your gear, either if you have a diamond worth 1000 gold or just mark 1000 gold off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is the initiation of the ritual. This is the reaching out to the soul, the bond, the thread that maintains the connection of the spirit to the prime material plane. Now, who would like to make a contribution to the ritual?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Please bring him back to me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a persuasion check with advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who wishes to take the next presentation?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have a couple things to say but I know I'm already--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Please, Scanlan, open your eyes and see your daughter's face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say go ahead and make-- make a performance check with advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you finish the poem you had wrote and step back, the second of the three portions of the circle comes aglow, and you realize, as she was speaking this poem, the chanting that she had begun has just continued without her, like as the ritual continues the chanting seems to have been taken and echoed by the actual essence of the spell. As she stepped out of the incantation it continued on its own; it continues to swell, stronger and stronger. At this point as you step back, there's a flash of movement at the edge of the altar, and with a double clack of her shoes, you watch Kaylie land her flip onto the top of the altar, stand up straight, wobble for a second, and catch her-- she pulls out her fiddle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I cast Lay on Hands and clear her mind of the alcohol.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I rolled a natural fucking 20, by the way guys, on that final roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's right there. I haven't touched it since it landed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two natural 20s. It was 14 for Kaylie's performance roll, and then a 20.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The fates just wanted Scanlan to come back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's true. And he was all poo-pooing on the dice

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There was--I mean with the DC increase, because he was at a 12. I missaid 13 last week, it was a 12, and we had two successes and one failure. That brought it from a 13, ten, to a seven. So we had a one through six and he would have been good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you all take in the moment, it appears that Scanlan's spirit has returned to the body.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. I don't think so, not yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth goes up and does a simple medicine check, just to see what's up with him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Go ahead and roll it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is borderline comatose right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It could be minutes, hours, days, who knows? But with the right treatment, usually people recover. It's not like a heavy skull trauma induced coma, it's just the physical exhaustion of the experience. So there may or may not be something you could do at the moment to rouse him from his slumber, but Scanlan lives.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy, can we station some of the best sages and doctors to watch over him?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We take him to the castle, I suppose, at this point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you mind if I carry him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's also drooling a little bit, and may have wet himself a second time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, as you guys begin to step outside-- Kerrek, you're there at the door after Kaylie charged out. Kima and Allura, who are just waiting outside, respectfully, are kind of engaged, but you watch as Kima immediately pushes up "Is he--?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "(sighs and then scoffs) And you were worried. So dumb." (laughs all around) Allura steps up behind her and puts her hands on Kima's shoulders and goes, "Well, that's good news. Take care of him. We'll probably return to Emon and help helm the "remainder of the cleaning, and situation, of Emon: gather the dead, see who we still have alive, "and come back soon with an idea of what we have to rebuild."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do an insight check?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's such a cool thing, what they have this month.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You know, if you love power rangers and leegos. I love leegos.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know, man, these lootcrates are great.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you haven't got one, you should.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We've all been through a lot. You should rest a day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, I have to rest before I can find our way back to Emon quicker, but the sooner the better. We did kind of leave the city in a vacuum of leadership, depending on who survived the conflict there, and I want to make sure that we have whatever remains of the council there to put the pieces back together and count the dead; make sure we don't leave a vacuum of power so that another Thordak-like entity can sweep in and lead us back on a dark path.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let us know if you need our assistance

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: " I shall. (sighs) I, for one, need to get clean." She taps Kima's shoulders, and Kima says, "Me too," and they both walk up towards the castle. What do you guys want to do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am going to go back the castle, sit down, take this off, and I think sleep for a long while.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, yeah. What time of day is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this time, the arrival here... It's pushing past sunset, I'm pretty sure. Or if not, it's probably early night at this time with the hour for the ritual, so--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where are we dropping off the urine smelling one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll take him to his room. I'll make sure someone cleans him up, dresses him, puts his things away.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're welcome to take him to his room.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll go with Grog and Scanlan.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I probably just drift along in everyone's wake at this point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Staggering behind a bit, just ruminating on the current events. Vex, you are still back at Kymal with Eskil Ryndarien, who has come back with drinks and says, "So...what business have you here, to drag me this far out to town?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We probably need our sleep right so that we can recharge those spells of yours as soon as possible.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (dryly) Oh, are you sure, darling? You're so attractive to me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I understand that, and I've had my heyday, but those years are long past me now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And he seems legitimately really disturbed and walks away.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I sit down next to Doctor Dranzel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, he's sitting. He's actually half passed out now, in the back corner. He wasn't there for the whole exchange with Kaylie. His hat's pushed over his eyes, and he has an empty tankard there in his one hand. You don't see where his other hand is. And you sit down?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I look to see where his other hand is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Didn't want to sit on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So do you know my coin is mine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He gives you a sort a brow push.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you hear what I said to Kaylie?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seems our old pal finally had his adventures catch up to him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do you feel about that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I've had friends come and go through the years. It's part of the job.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That can't be true. That cold...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hold onto my purse the entire time talking to him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22. You catch the crossbow still placed there, but his other hand has slipped underneath and has been slowly reaching toward your-

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trying to cop a feel, darling?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughing) He wiped a nose on his cheek.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But, yeah. Not cold, just pragmatic. When you lose enough people you learn to just move on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's a special pain in my ass. Nah, he's great. He'll be missed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To Scanlan Shorthalt and our brief but very lucrative carrier together. By the way, if you're curious, we're looking to sell off some of this really nice silverware that we--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He just smiles at you, his big bright toothy grin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm always lucky. That's why I'm still alive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. I've got a few more of these to put down. Stay safe, Vex'ahlia.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Don't come to my room. I'm serious, don't.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm not sure if you're serious...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Besides, you seem like you're already shacking up with a... curious gentleman.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (sarcastically) Isn't he dreamy? And I head upstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go ahead and find yourself up there with two separate rooms purchased by Eskil, all the way across the hall. He rapidly hands you the key, and says without making eye contact, "Your room is at the end, please, yes," and finds his way. You hear the door (clicking sound) and lock behind him

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I stay up for a really long time waiting to hear any kind of word from Allura, from anybody... Something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, nobody told Allura to contact you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I'll eventually go to sleep, wondering if Scanlan's alive.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We weren't done on our side.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Technically, chronologically, it wouldn't have happened yet, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of you guys back at the castle, anything else you want to prep for the evening?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could I, I'm so sorry, could I trouble you for that ring back, please?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Oh, oh, oh. No, he just takes it off. He hands it back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth taps Vax and says, Smooth. Nice one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you so much for following us into the fray. Literally, into the pit of the beast-- So, thank you. There's not a lot of people who would blindly follow us there.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: It was a pleasure, and it was a double pleasure to actually come out again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know if would say risking your life is a pleasure, but I appreciate your positive attitude on the whole thing. (chuckles)

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: It was nice to have something to do again. Something worthwhile to do again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'd say you definitely spent your time wisely. What do you plan to do next?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: If you folk are heading back to the city tomorrow, I should meet up with my people. They don't need me to shepherd them, exactly, but I should head back with them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I give him another hug and say goodnight and go in the castle.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm just staying outside his room.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was really looking forward to it, to be honest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She must be insane right now, or half drunk, or both.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I will make sure she knows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of course, of course. Sleep well. You've done-- you've done good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've all finished what I started.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we'll head back with you tomorrow to Emon so we can check in on our keep, once Vex'ahila comes back, of course

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, rest well. Have a good night." She goes back inside.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Kerrek will probably track down a bottle of some kind of really strong liquor and look for Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've seen where they keep most of it and since you're already an esteemed guest of the keepers here of Whitestone, they have given you a bottle, already open, but promised to have been fine quality and it doesn't take you long to hear the various bodily functions of Grog Strongjaw in the hallway, watching Scanlan's room. As it's now the middle of the night, close to midnight or so, you come across Grog alone leaning up against the wall, arms crossed, just waiting outside of Scanlan's room.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: And I just kind of pass the bottle over and say, Well, this is a better sort of vigil than what I've seen in the past.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why, that is true, that could have been much-- what is this?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: They seemed really impressed that they were giving it to me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They gave it to you. You didn't--

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: That's the extent of my knowledge. It looks brownish.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You didn't pay for it, no coin. You don't know if it's, like, cheap or expensive.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yeah, I'm guessing it's top shelf, not that I would know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I detect any notes of stuff?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, Gil. That's a three... No, that's a one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You detect notes of alcohol. Very strong alcohol.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We shall enjoy this to great lengths. May I commend you on the acquisition of a great-- I think I just stroked out on that word. Here.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: We chat a bit, and then I kind of bring up that whole resurrection ritual, slowly like, So that sort of thing has happened before with you folks?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But I have to say, before this group, I didn't even know people could do that, 'cause you know me. I can't do anything like that. Have you ever done one of those?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I... No, no. I... (sighs) I've looked into things like that, but I've never known anyone who's actually come back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, so are you saying, someone coming back is rare?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I've, I mean, I've heard stories, and I know, but I've never seen it myself and I've never... I don't know how much. I never knew how practical any of the stories were before.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't really know how pra-- pracsti-- they are either, but I guess I hadn't really thought about it much. It just seems like the others in the group are responsible for it. This one was hard, though. I felt like it might not work, you know?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, yeah. I mean, of the ones I've seen.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: And has it always been--? How-- do you need a body?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Uh... for what? To stay warm at night or for a resurrection? (all laugh)

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: No no, for a-- have you ever brought someone back when you didn't have the body?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, okay. Cause that would be-- what would you use? Like, you can't bring along, like, a tea cosy and then be like bam! You're back! How would that even work? What are you talking about?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Awake for three days and two wars and a dragon. That's why he's desperately trying to pump Grog for information about how the hell someone can come back--

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: And that's like, this is especially the only person I could trust to not realize that I was trying to get information out of him on this subject.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: And then when it does not-- when it dead ends, I just drink as much of that bottle as I can, moving it back and forth between the two of us for the rest of the night.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I hear them at all on the other side of the door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear them muttering from across the wall, but do you wanna listen in?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was actually hoping to be around the corner for a chunk of this, 'cause I was heading to Scanlan's room as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you guys make perception checks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So you, like, you take a big shiny thing, and then someone starts like "ay-ay-ah".

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pick up bits and pieces of it, and you're able to make out the gist of the conversation.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I'm gonna peek my head out the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, as you guys are finishing passing the bottle back and forth, Scanlan's door opens and Pike just barely pushes her head out from the crack.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What are you drinking? And why didn't you bring some to me?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit. Really good point. We might be in trouble, Kerr.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I will bring back two bottles.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They gave us two hands for two bott-- Pike, I am so wise right now.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You are--that must be like an intelligence serum.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Serum. Did they teach you that in your Sarenrae temple classes, because if not, maybe you have a thing or two to teach them now.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Probably not, Grog, but thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, now I am coming around the corner. I've waited long enough.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, Percival, you hear just enough to hear the talk about needing a body and then alcohol.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Percy, the gods gave you two hands for bottles for each of them!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Four if you can learn to use your feet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's too much. My brain will explode.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I insight check him, since I knew, since I could hear what was going on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Uh, sure. Make it with disadvantage, because it was through a wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to pick up nuances without seeing expressions and stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18? It's too hard to pick up without the nuances. From through a wall, I mean, the fact that you could pick up any of the words is one thing, but most of insight is based around facial expressions, physical activity. You have no idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That, too, yeah. So, you wander in. Kerr wandered away.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am going to wander into the room, with a nod and just sit for a moment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you sit for a bit, Kerr eventually returns with a second bottle of matching alcohol, unopened though, the same--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, so you go for a third bottle as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two unopened bottles of the same brackish liquor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so Pike and Percival, you have a fresh bottle jammed into your hand.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll be passing this around a bit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Should we all sit on the bed around Scanlan, like a slumber party?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Honestly I am thinking about going through his things, so no, I don't think it is.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh my god. What were you guys talking about out there? If I can be so rude to ask.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Uh, the liquor, it has fabulous brackish notes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. We make it here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was also talking about what a great job you do. Apparently, you're really rare.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What, did you-- why do you ask, Kerr?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And he is. He is still wearing his armor, unwashed. A few of you have gotten washed, a few of you are still kind of, you know, going over the events of today. Grog is not washed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So yes, he is still wearing his armor.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: And then just like dumps it on the floor, and then like the padding underneath. (groans)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a lot of shit you're wearing, man.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: You know what I forgot over all these years, like the sweat gathers in your ass.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: You'd think that I would remember but no, I had forgotten that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I forget, and then suddenly I remember that I met you all in a prison cell.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And at one point in your life you decide that suddenly for no reason, there's just-- you're just not allowed to die yet. Your life just isn't your own anymore, and suddenly you've done what you were supposed to do and now you're back. And it's just not yours anymore, is it? And what of everybody else? It's not fair, any of it. I don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't think your life is your own?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My life is this castle's. My life ended.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I don't understand how we get to choose.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To the unyielding unfairness of the universe.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not even here, and I'll drink to that one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And that it decided that we get to keep this bastard. Hardly fair.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do we tell him when he wakes up?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could just leave him in a gutter somewhere.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I keep thinking of terrible things to do to him now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have not explored any of that, and it is amazing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like once Vax is awake, we'll really have an expert at this sort of thing available.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I wish I could hear that!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You could run roughshod over that motherfucker.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're not in the room. You're not in the room, asshole!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is Liam talking to Taliesin.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's really debating though. How much have we had to drink?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it's up to you. Other members in this room have gotten quite drunk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, the math is always how much you've had to drink versus distance it takes to travel to your goal, 'cause they kinda balance each other out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The longer you have to go--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you're stationary, that's one thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Half of it's down stairs? I don't know.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We could play a prank on him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that's a great idea. I think I need somebody with a better mind for this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I walk out of the room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog leaves. Is there any other business you guys want to conduct before the evening's done?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did you want to go through his things?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A bit. That would be cruel. Well, you're a decent person. Should we?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Well, what if he happens to have something on him that requires attention?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I actually would agree, 'cause what if there's something, you know, that he needs our help with but feels weird about asking?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Right. Or if he has-- if there's-- well, I was thinking like a plant that needs watering--

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Except something you would have in your pocket, which is not a plant.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kerr, by the way, is pretty trashed at this point.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Can I go grab one of my-- I'm gonna go grab one of my nightgowns.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm gonna send for some desserts from downstairs.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is not cool when you wake up like this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, nightgown retrieved, pudding, a little stale but retrieved.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is my nightgown a little big on him? (all laugh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually yeah. You're a little thicker than Scanlan. Got some--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's right, I got all the games.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you have the nightgown and you have the pudding, what's the plan?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, first we're going to have to strip him

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're gonna put him in your nightgown.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're gonna just, sort of leave him hanging off the bed and decorate the entire room with all the desserts we've brought up and just smear them in interesting patterns and--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe some Latin everywhere. Just wonder what happened. Let's just leave him a tableau.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it's a fabulous idea.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right, so I'll start undressing him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right so Kerr, you watch as Percival and Pike begin undressing Scanlan's comatose body--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --and then stage by stage, taking handfuls of room temperature, probably day-old pudding--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --and desserts and smearing them across the room--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're gonna braid his hair as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It could be like a week before he wakes up all moldy and nasty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm gonna smear in some of it on his forehead so he can read it in the mirror backwards and it's just gonna say, 'no, never.' (all laugh)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: With a quill? (laughing) it's a lot of letters

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Gently, gently with your-- you can fit that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "Now what are you gonna do?" in cross stitch on my wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Take it however you feel, witnessing the event Kerrek--

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Actually, Kerr, at some point, is probably like, If you got some ribbons, get his hands.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With two of-- of the-- uh, yeah.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: No, no that's not that sort of knot.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: You have to wrap it around and then through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You unintentionally learn more about Kerrek's history than you expected to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I really I feel like I'm getting so many more chapters.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, and with the presentation complete, your diorama con Scanlan, the evening draws late. It is now probably a good 2:30, 3 o'clock in the morning upon completion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did I ever get a message?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did get a message from Allura that tells you that the ritual is successful. Scanlan is alive.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wake Trinket up. He's alive!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's alive! to the entire bar down below.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It worked! It worked! Who's awake!? Anyone? Is anyone awake?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You-- (laughs) you look down and there's maybe three people in the open expanse of the tavern floor, two of which are passed out on tables, one of them in their own vomit and there is-- the door to the tavern is still open and the one barkeep is somebody else has taken on the night shift, who's currently just sitting back and reading a book. Just kinda looks up at you, "Shhhhh."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I come running downstairs and keep drinking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Um, uh (sputtering) sure, I uh, I suppose."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Alright, um, I'll pour my drink.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's the best thing you've got? That's, you know, within reason? (all laugh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That'll be the Supple Wake, um--" And he pulls this dark red, terracotta jug from underneath and it has a wax seal on the top of it that's kind of currently closed off and he, "This'll run you about uh, 20 gold for the bottle. It's the best we have."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm in! Let's do it! and then pour a bowl of ale for my bear here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks over and he just sees like, lumbering across the room-- He didn't notice at the time, just kinda transfixed by your sudden strangeness.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cause he was in my necklace earlier when I came in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And just goes ahead and fills three small glasses--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --and puts over into a bowl and kinda sets it onto the edge and Trinket kinda pulls and grabs the edge of the bowl with a big claw and it tips over and kinda splashes--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Drink up, buddy. That's some expensive shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gets up on the top. Gets both arms up on the actual bar and is kinda like crushing the wood a little bit and knocked the bowl over and it's spilled out and he's like (slurping) and the guy's just sitting back leaning further and further away, grabs his glass...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What a great night! Ha! (drinking sound)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You wait three years to pull out that brand new sound effect of a cork (popping sound) coming out of a bottle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know! I spent a lot of time alone as a kid. (laughs)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We've been playing this game for like five years.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is like two and then-- two and a half, four and a half, I think.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we started back in nineteen aught five, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, evening comes full circle, rest comes about, the next day, presents you with rest, comfort. You're healful, you've restored your hit points, you get back half of your hit dice. Also, bright and early, as you all begin to kinda rouse from your slumber and wake up, Scanlan still asleep, still covered in the mess that you left him in. And shortly into the morning there is a series of quick (pounding sounds) footsteps up from the lower regions of the castle as Vex'ahlia arrives, freshly transported by Eskil Ryndarien to Whitestone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you rush in, you can see everybody kind of slightly groggily having their breakfast in the main eating hall of Whitestone castle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasp) Where is he? Where is he?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think he's actually like woken up yet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, oh! It takes a lot out of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How's everyone? Are you good? How'd it go?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm so glad to be here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How was your night? Where are-- did you-- how was it? How was that town?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know, I didn't see much of it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, me and Eskil had some times though, I can tell you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Really!? I never pegged him for like--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He put some moves on me, Percy. You should be aware.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point, you turn around in the room and you see Eskil entering with his little walking stick like (back cracking noises) (old man groan).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Eskil, you devil. You little pit fiend, you! Look at you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll take my meal in my room.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks again darling! It was wonderful.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispering) Oh, he's having a hangover meal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He slowly turns around. "Where is my manservant?" and he wanders off into the castle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So what are we doing today?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sigh) Well, I guess, I mean we-- I know Allura's going back to Emon to check in on things since we kind of left in a hurry but, I guess we should wait for Scanlan to wake up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's still a list of things that need to be taken care of.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah And I suppose we really shouldn't rush Scanlan, I mean, we might be able to do some of those.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kerrek now wanders in very hungover

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: (all laugh) I look every bit as old as I am

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He was talking about his butt getting sweaty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ah, yes I did. And we'll have a flashback now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (with a "narrator" voice) Where is Vax? (whooshing sounds)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fucking exhausted. Set down everything that I own on the altar, and took ten minutes to take off all the armor and lay that out on the altar and just, uh--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughs) And I just stare at it. For a long time wondering, What happens now? That's it. And then I stay there for the whole night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, as you guys continue breakfast--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Yeah. And you arrive and catch up with everybody and your brother's not there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (with her mouth full of candy) Where's Vax?!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He stayed in the Raven Queen's temple? I know that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think he did. I-- I don't know, I was up in the room that I--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's where we saw him last.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He stayed there when we left, so he could still be there? I'm not sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He didn't come back last night, so... I'm assuming he stayed there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's good to see you again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's good to see you too. Welcome home!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's in a really good mood.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe you should hit up Eskil for some tricks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that might be fun! (all laugh)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I didn't know you guys had that kind of relationship.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The girth of things you do not know could fill such a cavern.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I did. Ah, I love you. I'm so proud of you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The bad influence of Vox Machina.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Vex taught me that was funny! (all laugh)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow, thank you, I didn't need that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And then (slams) the door slams open, the bright light of the morning just (swooshes) across you as you're on the altar, and there you see, silhouetted in the light, the outline of your sister.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are you doing!? Trinket, stay outside, it's holy in here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't come in here, Trinket, I'm naked!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you really naked or are you just saying that? Where are you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I stand up and let my dinglies dangle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's pretty great, right? I turn my back to him so I can open my damn eyes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are you doing sleeping in here?!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I give her a naked hug from behind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ahh, creepy! Get off! Fucking gross!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You missed quite a performance, actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank God that trip wasn't for nothing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean... Can I turn around?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I think so? Right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know what she was up to, but-- What were you doing here! Why are you sleeping in this cold, creepy temple when everyone else is celebrating?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You encouraged me to embrace all this when I was complaining about--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, well, yes, of course. Not to the detriment of your happiness.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now that dragons are defeated and all of Tal'Dorei can live in peace and harmony and Vox Machina, the heroes that everyone was searching for...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Staying where? Here? Here in this temple? Here in Whitestone? I know what you're talking about. I mean, I do have a keep here. Right, a castle? A home.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can build. What're you gonna do? Would you stay?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is on my property after all! (laughs)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I was thinking... I mean, I don't know what any of us are doing, but I was thinking that I might go back with Keyleth. For a while.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, you're set, you're-- This is your home, now

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, it's-- Hasn't been very long, dear, who knows what's gonna happen?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would you like me to travel with you and Keyleth?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But no, I mean, you're my heart, you're me, you're my other half, you're welcome with me always.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (distressed) Why are we talking about this!? Don't talk about this now! This is a time of happiness, don't talk about sad things! Please... Please?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Happiest I've been in a long time. Long time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, you know, I'm in my undies, so...

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why don't you go and I'll catch up-- That takes like 22 minutes, though!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, what if I help you!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten minutes, then, right? Go get some breakfast, after all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have everything you need?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean we're all healed, everything's great?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you all had a night's rest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are we gonna do, we're bringing Scanlan with us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, not alone, we can have Keeper Yennen watch over him, we have a number of guard here, and soon as any word comes to his rousing we will make sure that it's sent to us.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Someone should probably roll him over and change his knots (snickers).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The nurses were given some instructions.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Actually he's just nodding, just laughing to himself, he just can't talk about anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As his laughter begins to build, a second set of laughter gets to join in, as you see coming around the corner, laughing a still drunk, not slept, Kaylie...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --comes with circles in her eyes, just goes, "Heh, well, that there's some fancy work, whoever did that".

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit, she saw the room.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're welcome, dear. Seemed the least we could do.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Figured it was appropriate when he woke up, that he would--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Knot, exactly! Knot! A few knots.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I think we should, those arms will be asleep, there's gonna be a problem up there if we don't-- (all laugh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know what, I'll stay here, I'll watch over him, I'll make sure the knots are changed in time. I kinda wanna be here to see his face.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did he break a leg or something?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, he just-- we wanted to make sure he stayed-- that he didn't--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispers) I feel like we're missing something.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Keeping him in the manner in which he is comfortable. (laughs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're sure? You'll be all right here? I'm sure Percy can let you have whatever you want, right, Percy? Just anything she wants.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: --and some drink, we definitely have that available. And the appropriate authorities have already been-- why are you all looking at me like that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I need to remind you of the title you gave me? Surely I hold some power in--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh, yeah, ooh, I wrote that title down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, of all of this and that? The Doinka Doink?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It doesn't really matter, I'm just saying, if she needs something while we're gone--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't hesitate to ask if you do need anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, I shall certainly ask. And I will need everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kind of rushes past you and sits down and starts eating the leftovers of whatever dish was not finished.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grand Poobah de Boink is the title.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Of all, yes, "In Charge of All Of This And That".

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need to add that to the Campaign Guide. I need to do that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Grand, what is it? Grand Poobah..?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like Des Moines, but de Boink.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Now, please, hands together." And there's a rush of cold wind (whooshing sound) which takes up suddenly the familiar sensation of teleportation as you're all thrust back into the outside of the Cloudtop District, exterior of the gates. You can see there's still smoke rising up, but as opposed to the clouds of billowing cinders and flame, it appears that most buildings in the immediate vicinity, while black and darkened and broken, no longer rage of burning fire. The smoke has gone from pitch-black to bits of dark grey and plumes of white. You can see already there is a bustle throughout the city as a number of bodies are laid out across the ground with bits of gathered cloth placed over them, those who had fallen in the battle and are being gathered, being prepared to be brought back to their families.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I see any sign of the Ashari, and what do the clouds look like?

lines.text: A magic, a force as potent in that. You're blessed to have found it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if her aid-- (clears throat) What if her aid was best used--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: -- in the world. And not maybe in a museum.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is your choice, not mine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think perhaps there will come a time, but that it is not yet time to put the staff to rest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow. Just walk away. Walk away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, I don't want to hold on to anything if it doesn't rightfully belong to me, but this has also been lost for a long time. So who does it rightfully belong to? And I'm trying to do good with it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (shushes) She reaches out and touches your forehead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I just-- I don't wanna--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's all right. We mean not to take it from you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If it still has purpose in your hands, keep it. Keep it safe. Do not lose it as you say it was once lost. And when you find the need for such power no longer necessary, then return it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I'm very grateful, and I do feel very blessed that I found it and that I have this power.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then use it to spread her love. Use it to spread her comfort and protection.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Champion of Melora! I see it now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there something I could do to show my thanks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think that the fact that you still hold that to this day means that her favor smiles on you. If you walk the path she rides, maybe you'll find a way to talk with her yourself. But there is no key, there is no trick, there is no secret. She speaks through the growing buds of the flowers below, she speaks through the rain that comes and brings water to them to grow. I'm sure she's spoken to you most of your life. Maybe now your ears are open to listen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I will not forget your words.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I hope not. There is great wisdom in that staff, as there is great wisdom in you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You doubt yourself too much, child.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: People keep telling me that. Okay. All right. Thank you. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She takes your hand and cups it into both of hers and holds it for a second.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we get to leave the arboretum now? (everyone laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was beautiful, though, while it lasted.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it'll grow back, Grog.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, take your foot off and watch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can't. I'm scared, they're looking really close.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's get her out of here before they change their mind, alright? Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I could watch your moral panic all day, it's so delightful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys make your way out of the Birth Heart, into the Abundant Terrace, what do you wish to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: See, that was not such a big deal. All that fuss for a box in the dirt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we need to stock up on supplies?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, yeah. We haven't been to a right proper store in a long time, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Do you need to check in on the temple?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I dunno, I just still feel weird about it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, this might be a bit of a wild hare, but watching you back there, I had a thought. Grog.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was fuckin' awful. You seem a bit punchy. You wanna take her--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To let off a little bit of steam?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you sure you weren't here? Were you not?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think she had just left.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that's right. The Crucible is a pit fighting arena next to the temple of Kord, right? Around that area?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In the Trial Forge. Yeah. One on one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We know you are an angel, but we know that you also have a little bit of piss and vinegar in you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's pretty much fisticuffs in the Crucible.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I wanna find two pretty reasonable fire-starting stones.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make a perception check-- well, this would be investigation, 'cause you're--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Damn it. I'm gonna keep looking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What're you doing with a rock?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Doesn't seem like something you normally look for.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I was just thinking that he needs a gift.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean does anybody-- You got a gift for me?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. I mean, I dunno about anybody else, but besides the store, I would like to go by the temple of Kord again. Just pop in. I don't want to bore anybody.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sure we bored you several times with our god mumbo-jumbo.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tell me how you really feel, Grog. Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know what? Never mind. I take all of it back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I thought you-- all right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tangentially, not today, not for a while. I need to go back to--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The temple of the Raven Queen?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you even want to today?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I don't want to today.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thought you were gonna come back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you guys are walking, where are you headed? Are you headed to the Birth--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I mean, I would like to go to the temple of Kord. Pike, do you want to see--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (aside to Taliesin) What do you want for me to cantrip?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (aside to Marisha) Well, I just want, like, another one. Two.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does that exist somewhere in this city, the Oubliette?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two plinths? Yeah, I think I can Druidcraft that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It it likely that we have--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right. Oh, out of character, Ashley, I wish you were here next week.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're gonna get into a fuckin' fist fight!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you looking at your schedule?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we make our way towards the Temple of Kord?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, so you guys make your way to the Birth Heart. It's easy to follow. Out of all the areas in here that are more clean-- the Birth Heart, sorry, the Braving Grounds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Braving Grounds is where all the ironwork, metalwork, smithy, and refining of various burnable fuels are maintained. So you see the plumes of coal smoke coming out of the various forges. You head that direction, following that as a very definitive visual reference point. It takes you the better part of an hour or so, making your way through the crowds, the Bastions, and it seems like not a whole lot has changed since last time you were in Vasselheim. For all the chaos and destruction you have seen in Tal'Dorei, it appears that Isilra is none the wiser, and life goes on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You make your way through the Braving Grounds to the Trial Forge. And there you see before you the large Temple of Kord, the dark deep red rusted iron color of the temple, with the statue on top. The front doors, the tall, thin doors are open just enough for about two shoulders-width of people to walk through. The interior appears to be brightly lit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you want to go inside? Only the strong may enter.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. I would like to go inside.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we wait out here for you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Meh. You can come in if you want.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The hallway's just this straight shot to the central cross section.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's strange. There's usually people here. (clears throat) Hello?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You keep walking, making your way down the smooth, dark, granite-like floors. You can see the tall archway just continues and the repeated pattern of the pillars that mark the strength portions of the archway, meeting in the center, just over and over again, like this oversized spinal column, almost, in the way that it's segmented, eventually coming to where the center points cross, where the sand pit, you recall, the center of the Trial Forge was. As you approach, you see a singular figure standing in the center of the pit, facing away from you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That without my friends, and love, my strength would be nothing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then show me what you have learned.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Show me." And he turns around. (smashing sound) And he--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- slams his fists into the side and the sand that's around him (exploding sound), dusts out in this small arc and then rests in the ground and he looks up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm having a DBZ orgasm right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (sings the Dragon Ball Z theme song)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Show me what you've got! (everyone laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long have you waited-- how long have you--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Since, like, whenever you got back to the Trial Forge--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll pick up on, pick up on that next week.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fight! (Taliesin and Marisha sing the Mortal Kombat Theme)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but in the best way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was Scanlan, Vax, and me against him--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: -- and we were giving him everything we had with Craven Edge, and he was just shrugging it off, like--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we were slashing through at his forearms and then he would, like, go (grunting sound) and all the wounds would heal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who did he one-hit punch? The one punch?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, and he could have killed Vax.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With one punch. But he held it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He held back specifically. He was just teaching Grog a lesson.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He just held him one hit, like boom! And Vex went waaaaah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But in a good way. He's, like, super, super smart.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, the last time he was like, "Where does your strength come from?" And I'm like, "My rage!"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, we'll see where this picks up next week.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And don't forget, tomorrow at noon, these dice go on sale!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's not an infinite amount, but they're there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No there's more than there were last time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have been awesome, being with us for this long.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And, as always, be sure to check in on Talks Machina on Tuesday at 7.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think you should call him Breen Wiser Fester.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, Brain Fester! That was-- yeah, the Brain Fester.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll pick it up next week. Uh, is it Thursday yet?
